greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, if n = p^k for some prime p and exponent k >= 1, then a(n) = -k, otherwise a(n) = 1+A085970(n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
formula: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, if n = p^k for some prime p and exponent k >= 1, then a(n) = -k, otherwise [when n is not a prime power], a(n) = 1+A085970(n) = running count from 2 onward.
program: partialsums(f,up_to) = { my(v = vector(up_to), s=0); for(i=1,up_to,s += f(i); v[i] = s); (v); }
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 02 2018
